abstract: The Motorola Xoom, one of the most eagerly awaited iPad rivals, has arrived. It has slightly upgraded hardware, but its Google tablet software, known as Honeycomb, is the more important story.
snippet: The Motorola Xoom, one of the most eagerly awaited iPad rivals, has arrived. It has slightly upgraded hardware, but its Google tablet software, known as Honeycomb, is the more important story.
lead_paragraph: It’s an old pattern by now. Phase 1: Apple introduces some new gadget. The bloggers and the industry tell us why it’ll fail. Phase 2: It goes on sale. The public goes nuts for it. Phase 3: Every company and its brother gets to work on a copycat.

headline.main: Before Rush, One Tablet Stands Out
headline.print_headline: Before Rush, One Tablet Stands Out
